item.description:
For all the new or old members, or for those who’ve come late to the AT party, or for anyone who’d like a comparatively flat, although long hike, there’s the AT4 “catch-up” Hike...

where any number of us RI Outdoors members can take advantage of a second opportunity to say that we’ve (and I apologize for this)... "mustard" through 12 miles of the Massachusetts Appalachian Trail so that in the end, we can "relish" (and again, I am truly sorry for this)... "relish" in the accomplishment of hiking the entire Massachusetts leg of the Appalachian Scenic Trail (should you choose to make that your goal), or if we just consider this leg, 12 miles of early winter hiking through the Berkshire mountains.

I do want to be "frank," this is 12 miles... a 12 mile winter hike w/a bit of elevation gain (1200’) and short daylight hours, so it is important that we leave on time and manage a steady moderate pace to avoid getting ourselves into a... into ahhh... (and I’m NOT apologizing for this one)... into a "pickle" by being caught out after dark.

We will meet at the AT trailhead on Main Rd in Tyringham, which coincidentally will be our ending location (map). We'll then spot half the cars and drive over to the AT trailhead on Rt 23 (the ending location of the AT3 leg) and begin our hike from here (map). 

Route Information (starting from Rt 23)

1.2 miles to Beartown State Forest

2.1 miles to Mt Wilcox South Shelter

1.8 miles to Mt Wilcox North Shelter

2.3 miles to exit of Beartown State Forest

1.8 miles to Shaker Campsite

2 miles to Jerusalem road

1.1 miles to Tyringham main rd



EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Cold Weather/Fall Essentials (required):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants
• Synthetic Quick-drying L/S Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes (preferably waterproof)
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Light/Mid-weight Insulating Layers (undershirt/underpants)
• Extra pair of Socks
• Hat/Gloves
• Rain/Soft Shell Jacket/Pants
• Water (2-3L)
• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• MICROspikes, STABLicers, ect... (a must when there's snow or ice on the trail)


the Remaining Essentials:
• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant/Toiletries
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if your insulated or rain jacket isn’t windproof)
• Hand Warmers
• Trekking Poles
• Gaiters
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars


Is This Hike for Me?

This is a lengthy hike with some elevation gains. We will be moving at good pace because of the hike's length, so know that you can maintain a moderate pace for the length of the hike. Be prepared, dress in layers, bring plenty of insulation, water (2-3L), food, and something warm to drink.  No jeans or cotton. Hiking boots/shoes (preferable waterproof), not sneakers. Rain gear if the forecast calls for rain. Severe weather cancels this event.


Directions (to Tyringham trailhead):

From Providence: 2 hours 20 minutes
From Newport: 3 hours

Find your way to the Mass. Turnpike (exit 2) & the Rt 102/Rt 20 intersection. Follow 102 south, turning left, almost immediately, onto Tyringham Road. Follow Tyringham Rd as it becomes Main Rd. Continue past the Tyringham post office (118 Main Rd) for about 1 mile. The trailhead parking lot is on the right between Jerusalem and Monterey Roads.

Google Maps:
http://maps.google.com/maps...

Lat/Long: 42.2355, -73.19440


Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: AT Trailhead on Main Rd, Tyringham, MA, between Jerusalem & Monterey; look for a grey Jetta w/ CT plates. Cell: 860-460-1500. See directions below.
item.name: Mass. Appalachian Trail: Part 4 (AT4 "catch-up" Hike)
